snippet: The state’s largest utility has sued three rural counties, saying they have done too little to prevent nitrates from farmland from getting into drinking water.
abstract: Iowa water utility Des Moines Water Works has filed suit against leaders of three counties, seeking to make farmers comply with federal cleanwater standards for nitrate runoff in bid to protect drinking water supply fed by Raccoon River; farmers call suit confrontational approach that hinders progress and discounts voluntary changes being made by farmers.
lead_paragraph: The state’s largest utility has sued three rural counties, saying they have done too little to prevent nitrates from farmland from getting into drinking water.

headline.main: Conflict Over Soil and Water Quality Puts ‘Iowa Nice’ to a Test
headline.print_headline: Conflict Over Soil and Water Quality Puts ‘Iowa Nice’ to a Test
